raw.title: [BIP-823] Enable Gauge for Safe Haven QuantAMM BTF
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1992

**Summary:**
This is a proposal to enable the gauge on Ethereum for the QuantAMM Blockchain Traded Fund (BTF) Safe Haven pool (BTFSH: [`0x6B61D8680C4F9E560c8306807908553f95c749C5`](https://etherscan.io/address/0x6B61D8680C4F9E560c8306807908553f95c749C5)).

**References/Useful links:**

• [QuantAMM Website](https://quantamm.fi)
• [QuantAMM Documentation](https://quantamm.fi/documentation)
• [Protocol Repo](https://github.com/QuantAMMProtocol/QuantAMM-V1)

**Protocol Description:**


QuantAMM introduces Blockchain Traded Funds, automatic dynamic weight Balancer V3 pools. These are dynamic strategy pools that can capitalise on price movements while earning fees and yields. BTFs have a trading function where the weights are time dependent, allowing slightly off-market prices, and so utilise arbitrageurs to rebalance underlying pool holdings to the desired weights.

This first BTF is the "Safe Haven" BTF, containing wBTC, PAXG and USDC. Safe Haven here refers to the concept of safe haven assets in finance. The pool runs a trend following strategy, and was tuned using [quantammsim](https://quantammsim.readthedocs.io/), the QuantAMM Balancer Simulator.

**Motivation:**

QuantAMM is launching the Safe Haven BTF, the first BTF as part of the Balancer V3 launch partnership. Incentives will bring a range of LPs to try this new type of pool on Balancer V3.

**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** The BTFs run automatically under normal circumstances. BTFs created by the QuantAMM team have multi-sig delayed break glass controls to modify the strategy state. New pools require approval to run on the QuantAMM update weight runner by the same admin multi-sig. New oracles need to also be approved before use to check oracle manipulation is not a risk.

2. **Oracles:** Chainlink Oracles are used daily in the Safe Haven BTF to calculate the strategy's target weights (but not the pool quoted prices). Strategy smoothing also provides a secondary layer of protection beyond Chainlink's controls, further protecting against oracle manipulation risk.
 For this BTF pool they are:
- ChainlinkDataFeedBTC: [`0xF4030086522a5bEEa4988F8cA5B36dbC97BeE88c`](https://etherscan.io/address/0xF4030086522a5bEEa4988F8cA5B36dbC97BeE88c)
- ChainlinkDataFeedPAXG: [`0x9944D86CEB9160aF5C5feB251FD671923323f8C3`](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9944D86CEB9160aF5C5feB251FD671923323f8C3)
- ChainlinkDataFeedUSDC: [`0x8fFfFfd4AfB6115b954Bd326cbe7B4BA576818f6`](https://etherscan.io/address/0x8fFfFfd4AfB6115b954Bd326cbe7B4BA576818f6)


5. **Audits:** We have had audits by Cyfrin and Codehawks, see [here](https://github.com/QuantAMMProtocol/QuantAMM-V1/tree/main/pkg/pool-quantamm/audit).

6. **Centralization vectors:** There is a multi-sig admin account (`0xd785201fd2D9be7602F6682296Bb415530C027Ef`) that is controlled by QuantAMM. A Chainlink time-based automation job (`0x4c2750430acc1dfe6eb959982d0e5835901ddcd4`) is also a point of centralisation.

8. **Market History:** [The protocol website](https://quantamm.fi) shows historic simulation of the BTC/PAXG/USDC pool based on the fixed chosen parameters and historic price series, and this has been presented at previous office hours/state of the DAO calls on Discord.
 
9. **Value:** BTFs are secondary market products and do not intend to be the primary market for any constituent token.

**Technical Specification:**

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:

Gauge (Address): [`0x093E02dEC0b5A40c03D84eCdA6058AD91436923f`](https://etherscan.io/address/0x093E02dEC0b5A40c03D84eCdA6058AD91436923f)
gaugeType(string): Ethereum

Edit Maxis:
- assign BIP ID
- add payload

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-381] Enable Aave Boosted USDC/USDC.e Gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/398

**Summary:**

> This pool uses the composable stable pool factory v5 and contains two separate linear pool tokens; bb-a-USDC and bb-a-USDC. These are Balancer’s AAVE boosted Arbitrum native USDC, and bridged USDC. As Circle migrates from bridged to native USDC there are several dexes offering the ability to swap between both assets, which do bring in considerable volume. Balancer protocol will be earning yield on both boosted portions of this pool, making the token pairing more efficient for LPs. This gauge would enter as a “core pool” under BIP-19, meaning protocol fees earned by this pool would be used to bribe for votes on it. The gauge can be uncapped.

**References/Useful links:**

> USDC: Link to:
> • [Website ](https://www.circle.com/en/usdc)
> • [Documentation ](https://developers.circle.com/docs/what-is-usdc)
> • [Github Page ](https://github.com/centrehq/centre-tokens)
> • [Communities ](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/usd-coin) - Coingecko link

**Protocol Description:**

> bb-a-USDC is a Balancer’s USDC boosted token implementation of USDC, leveraging AAVE’s boosted strategy. USDCe is bridged USDC from mainnet to Arbitrum.

**Motivation:**

> This provides a trading route between the two USDC assets on Arbitrum. With the boosted aspect, an A of 5000, and swap fee of 0.005%, this swap route highly competitive, and more sustainable for liquidity providers to place their funds. The risk of a high A factor exposing the pool to being off balance is mute due the assets being virtually interchangeable. Competitors use higher swap fees and see utilization upwards of 100%. 

**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** USDC is centralized and does not have a governance forum. 
2. **Oracles:** This pool only relies on the rate providers of the linear pools to inform when yield is earned.
3. **Audits:** N/A
4. **Centralization vectors:** USDC is inherently centralized. 
5. **Market History:** See [here ](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/usdc).
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on underlying bb-a-USDC and bb-a-USDCe yield. BIP-19 will incentivize TVL to continue to grow here with trading volume and this implementation will continue to draw in new volume, as well as showcase the power of these pool types.

Link to pool [0x9ceBf13BB702F253AbF1579294694A1eDAD00EAA](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x9cebf13bb702f253abf1579294694a1edad00eaa000000000000000000000486)
Link to gauge: [0x90DDAa2A6D192Db2F47195d847626F94E940c7Ac](https://etherscan.io/address/0x90DDAa2A6D192Db2F47195d847626F94E940c7Ac)

**Specification:**

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0x90DDAa2A6D192Db2F47195d847626F94E940c7Ac`

gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-459] Enable TetuBAL/20WETH-80BAL Gauge [Polygon]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/579

**Summary:**
The purpose of this proposal is to enable gauge for the newly [created](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0x7af62c1ebf97034b7542ccec13a2e79bbcf34380000000000000000000000c13) tetuBal/20WETH-80BAL with updated AMP (**20** instead of **500**) to align with the recommendations from the balancer core team and community. All the other parameters are the same as in the existing [pool](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0xb797adfb7b268faeaa90cadbfed464c76ee599cd0002000000000000000005ba).

Previous gauge [proposal](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-8-enable-tetubal-20weth-80bal-gauge/3335)

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
*    Previous gauge [proposal](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-8-enable-tetubal-20weth-80bal-gauge/3335)
* Website -[ https://tetu.io/ 2 ](https://tetu.io/)
* Documentation -[ Introduction - Tetu ](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/)
* Github Page -[ Tetu · GitHub ](https://github.com/tetu-io)
* Communities -[ Tetu ]()

**Protocol Description:**

Tetu is an asset management protocol that implements automated yield farming strategy for users.

**Motivation:**
To maintain tetuBal peg and attract more liquidity to the pool. It will be beneficial for both Balancer and Tetu protocols.

 
**Specifications:**

1. Governance:[ Multi Sig - Tetu ](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/security/multi-sig)
2. Oracles: No
3. Audits:[ docs.tetu.io ](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/security/audits)
4. Centralization vectors: n/a
5. Market History: Tetu token can be volatile in the certain market conditions.


Composable Stable Pool: [0x7aF62C1ebf97034B7542CcEC13a2e79BbcF34380](https://polygonscan.com/address/0x7aF62C1ebf97034B7542CcEC13a2e79BbcF34380)

Gauge: [0xF6A814eD60653Cb0e36DA247B01E6309318328d4](https://etherscan.io/address/0xF6A814eD60653Cb0e36DA247B01E6309318328d4)

### Technical Specification
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0xF6A814eD60653Cb0e36DA247B01E6309318328d4`
gaugeType(string): `Polygon`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-580] Enable sfrxETH / cbETH pool [Base]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/884

## Summary:

* This is a proposal to enable a Balancer gauge for a sfrxETH/cbETH pool on Balancer on Base.
* This will be a core pool.
* The pool has been launched [here](https://app.balancer.fi/#/base/pool/0x98bedb6a3c0b6feebbe662e6419481a6877d9681000000000000000000000104)

## References/Useful links:

Link to:

• [Website](https://frax.finance/)

• [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)

• [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)


## Protocol Description:

sfrxETH is a staked interest bearing version of FRAX’s staked ETH (frxETH). Coinbase Wrapped Staked ETH (cbETH) represents your staked Ethereum (ETH) in a tradable form. You can unwrap cbETH at any time. cbETH provides flexibility to sell, transfer, or use it. You can move cbETH to a personal wallet and trade it outside the Coinbase platform.

## Motivation:

As a joint effort with FRAX, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for Frax assets on Base. The BAL gauge and core pool status will facilitate the process.

## Specifications:

* Governance: FRAX governance process can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/smart-contracts/governance) and their snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
* Oracles: Chainlink feed for rate can be found [here](https://data.chain.link/feeds/base/base/sfrxETH-frxETH).
* Audits: See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
* Centralization vectors: see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview).
* Market History: See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
* Value: Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sfrxETH and cbETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://app.balancer.fi/#/base/pool/0x98bedb6a3c0b6feebbe662e6419481a6877d9681000000000000000000000104

Link to child gauge: [0x1cadBEFEB5461a671CfAAf5faC237aF00baC0B1c](https://basescan.org/address/0x1cadBEFEB5461a671CfAAf5faC237aF00baC0B1c#code)

Link to root gauge: [0x3CFfb5d5Db1dA8AA58908e54C03a7f8a7edb233c](https://etherscan.io/address/0x3CFfb5d5Db1dA8AA58908e54C03a7f8a7edb233c)

## Technical Specification:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860 will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0x3CFfb5d5Db1dA8AA58908e54C03a7f8a7edb233c`

gaugeType(string): `Base`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-373] Enable 80IDLE-20USDC Gauge [Ethereum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/383

**Summary**
This proposal is to add a veBAL gauge for the new 80IDLE/20USDC pools on Ethereum.

**References/Useful links**
Idle’s link to:
• [Website](https://idle.finance/#/)
• [Documentation](https://docs.idle.finance/)
• [Github Page](https://github.com/Idle-Finance/)
• [Communiy on Discord]()

**Protocol Description**
Idle launched the Best Yield in [2019](https://medium.com/idle-finance/idle-tokenizing-the-best-interest-rate-among-ethereum-money-market-9a5ab30ea585), a yield aggregation and optimization strategy, allowing LPs to automatically receive the best return across Aave and Compound without the need to monitor the performances of the underlying markets.

In [2021](https://medium.com/idle-finance/introducing-perpetual-yield-tranches-guarded-launch-phase-1-12978c25b0f0), Idle released Perpetual Yield Tranches, a new risk-tranching primitive to access emerging markets with two different risk-return profiles: Senior and Junior.

[This year](https://medium.com/idle-finance/beyond-the-yield-spectrum-introducing-junior-best-yield-vaults-a1402909e449), Idle merged the power of Best Yield aggregation with the risk-adjusted returns of Perpetual Yield Tranches. Senior Best Yield, the evolution of the original Best Yield, expands the underlying sources by adding Senior Tranches alongside Aave and Compound, maintaining the same conservative risk profile while extending and improving the yield spectrum. Junior Best Yield aggregates multiple Junior Perpetual Yield Tranches to create a seamless yield generation of boosted performances.

Idle’s product suite is governed by [Idle DAO](https://docs.idle.finance/governance/idle-dao), represented by [IDLE](https://etherscan.io/address/0x875773784af8135ea0ef43b5a374aad105c5d39e) token holders.

**Motivation**
After the release of the Balancer boosted pool [bb-i-usd](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x60683b05e9a39e3509d8fdb9c959f23170f8a0fa000000000000000000000489), currently sitting at $1.8m liquidity, a [new governance proposal](https://gov.idle.finance/t/amm-liquidity-improvements/1176) has been posted on the Idle forum.

This proposal aims to increase current protocol-owned liquidity by 2x by launching the 80IDLE-20USDC pool on Balancer and deploying treasury funds.

The [pool](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x158e0fbc2271e1dcebadd365a22e2b4dd173c0db0002000000000000000005a5) has already been seeded by Idle DAO.

By incentivizing veBAL voters as a form of LM, we identified the next steps to adopt the 80-20 model and make it a core infrastructure for IDLE liquidity provision.

The use of an 80-20 pool would reduce liquidity provision’s barriers for IDLE token holders, given the limited pool share of non-IDLE assets, and incentivize its decentralized nature.

**Specifications**
1. Governance: USDC is centralized and does not have a governance forum. Idle’s governance details can be seen [here](https://docs.idle.finance/governance/introduction).
2. Oracles: Idle does not rely on oracles for fund allocations. Chainlink is used for IDLE liquidity mining on Senior Best Yield.
3. Audits: See Idle’s [here](https://docs.idle.finance/developers/security)
4. Centralization vectors: USDC is inherently centralized.
5. Market History: See USDC [here](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/usd-coin).
6. Value: The pool aims to be the primary source of liquidity for the token.

Link to pool: [0x158e0fbc2271e1dcebadd365a22e2b4dd173c0db0002000000000000000005a5](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x158e0fbc2271e1dcebadd365a22e2b4dd173c0db0002000000000000000005a5)
Link to gauge: [0x9aaAf6757BE9e115895429EF6B81e05dCB951646](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9aaAf6757BE9e115895429EF6B81e05dCB951646#readContract)

**Specification**
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0x9aaAf6757BE9e115895429EF6B81e05dCB951646`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

This gauge is initially set with a 2% cap.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal to enable a gauge for the QuantAMM Base Macro BTF on Balancer V3 is supported unanimously by voting timeline metrics and adjacent similar successful proposals. Forum sentiment is mostly neutral with one negative detailed comment but does not outweigh the strong vote support. This change is expected to bring new liquidity providers and incentives, aligning with prior successful gauge enablement proposals.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous voting support with early and stable votes for enabling the gauge.
Similar past proposals to enable gauges have passed successfully and increased TVL.
Proposal introduces incentives to attract LPs to the new QuantAMM Base Macro BTF on Balancer V3.
Technical and governance specifications include safeguards like multi-sig controls and Chainlink oracles.
key_arguments_against: One forum comment expressed concerns, reflected in negative sentiment, but mainly informational rather than opposing the proposal.
Centralization vectors exist due to multi-sig admin control and Chainlink automation.

evidence.quote: One detailed comment provided background on QuantAMM and the proposal, showing negative sentiment but informative context.
All four votes support 'Yes, let's do it' option with high voting power and early vote ratio of 1.0.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Voting timeline metrics show unanimous and stable early support for enabling the gauge.
- Adjacent similar proposals also passed with positive TVL impacts, indicating successful past outcomes.
- Forum sentiment is mostly neutral with one negative comment providing detailed background; overall community sentiment does not contradict the vote outcome.
- This proposal introduces incentives to attract liquidity providers to Balancer V3, supporting the protocol's growth.
- The recommendation aligns with aggregated sentiment and vote progress, maximizing long-term organizational benefit.
